ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Analytical skills developed in selecting an appropriate model to use before incorporating assumptions to answer a question.
The physico chemical processes of water treament  and wastewater treatment
Applications for different physical and chemical phenomena to water treatment; literature review skills; derivations from oter examples.

Fundamental reaction engineering relevant to environmental engineering, membrane processes and phenomena (e.g., concentration polarization), coagulation phenomena, granular filtration phenomena, adsorption, disinfection. Both theory and applications of these different concepts with an understanding of their use and limitations.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The content of the class was interesting but not the most engaging.

The homeworks for this course were vastly different than the material that was covered in class, making even starting the homeworks difficult. There was too great of an emphasis on California and Israel for water treatment, an entire world of examples exists and would engage a greater global focus to engineering. Several times, multiple assignments would be due in the same timeframe which could be improved for greater continuity of the course.
I wish I had solid background prior to this course

Course notes were exceptionally well-organized. The literature review parts of homework assignments were difficult, but hold practical application to writing papers for a PhD. Exams tested key ideas, rather than busy work.

Some homework problem solutions were not clear from class notes, and required TA intervention in order to find the correct method.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: No, unless it is absolutely required or another professor was leading this course.
Yes would, as long as they have great background. However this was an interesting course.
I would recommend this course to another student, with the caveat that more time will be required than other courses if you want to get everything out of it that you can.
